entry.title: Populating Dropdowns in PHP (1/2)
entry.content:
A brief look at populating a simple dropdown (an HTML select element) with data from a MySQL database, using PHP. We'll also look at joining two tables, and showing more information when an option is selected.
Watch the full series at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLfdtiltiRHWE9zhEn8BA3Y_-ygBB0t5CN
Subscribe here for more tutorials: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=phpacademy
Our channel http://youtube.com/phpacademy
Official website http://phpacademy.org
Support Forum http://phpacademy.org/forum
Follow us on Twitter! http://twitter.com/phpacademy

entry.title: Cookies & Sessions in PHP: What are they, and what's the difference?
entry.content:
Diving into what sessions and cookies are, and then looking at how we use them, and why we might use them. Also, an important look at some security consideration when using sessions and cookies, as well as some other tips.
If you need to learn what sessions and cookies are, and how to use sessions and cookies with PHP, this video has you covered!
Subscribe here for more tutorials: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=phpacademy
Our channel http://youtube.com/phpacademy
Official website http://phpacademy.org

entry.title: Chrome Developer Tools Device Emulator, and more!
entry.content:
An overview of the new Device Emulators in Chrome Developer Tools. Itâ€™s fast, easy and fun to get your responsive site looking good on any device.
Responsive web design means your website adapt to different screen sizes, regardless of whether you're building for tablet, mobile, desktop, TV, or any other devices that become available.
Subscribe here for more tutorials: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=phpacademy
For more DevTips, Travis recommends this series on the Bootstrap Grid: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLqGj3iMvMa4IPwMW-sSXn1Q_pVu5tUMCw

entry.title: Amazon S3 with PHP: Tokenising Download URLs (5/6)
entry.content:
Protect a download link with a tokenised (signed) URL, to avoid anyone with the URL downloading it. This is useful for membership systems where you want to allow users to download a file from your S3 bucket, but stops them passing the link to someone else to download.
Watch the full series at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLfdtiltiRHWE0uv1ZEL5d3Jt4i3qU-607

Our channel http://youtube.com/phpacademy
Official website http://phpacademy.org
Support Forum http://phpacademy.org/forum
Follow us on Twitter! http://twitter.com/phpacademy

entry.title: Amazon S3 with PHP: Introduction (1/6)
entry.content:
Instead of storing files on your server, let Amazon S3 take care of storing and serving files for you. In this series we look at uploading, listing, getting file URLs and tokenising URLs to protect them (e.g. under a membership only system). We finish off by taking a look at video streaming through CloudFront and S3.
Watch the full series at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLfdtiltiRHWE0uv1ZEL5d3Jt4i3qU-607
Subscribe here for more tutorials: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=phpacademy
Our channel http://youtube.com/phpacademy
Official website http://phpacademy.org
Support Forum http://phpacademy.org/forum
Follow us on Twitter! http://twitter.com/phpacademy

media:group.media:description:
Instead of storing files on your server, let Amazon S3 take care of storing and serving files for you. In this series we look at uploading, listing, getting file URLs and tokenising URLs to protect them (e.g. under a membership only system). We finish off by taking a look at video streaming through CloudFront and S3.
Watch the full series at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLfdtiltiRHWE0uv1ZEL5d3Jt4i3qU-607

entry.title: Fast Development Environments with Bowery
entry.content:
Bowery have updated their desktop application so you can quickly host a project without the need for AWS keys. Here, we look at rapidly setting up a LAMP stack, so you can avoid complicated virtual machines or WAMP/MAMP/XAMPP.

entry.title: PHP Currency Conversion: Building The Class (1/2)
entry.content:
Choosing an API, we create a class that converts any amount of currencies and values. We're using the free currency conversion API, found here: http://www.freecurrencyconverterapi.com/

entry.title: Dropbox With PHP: Searching Files (6/6)
entry.content:
You might need to search files in a user's Dropbox, and thankfully this is made really easy. Just pass the search query and Dropbox will return any files that match!
Watch the full series at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLfdtiltiRHWGOceoK3I3LrDL6x8mM0Ipb
